channel.title: Need Help With a Compiler Problem
channel.description: I've been trying to make a runescape private server, and i got a source, Testscape, as i heard it was easy to code, but i cant compile it.... I already googled the hell out of and couldn't find a solution. I came crossed a compiler and successfully got that into the compiler file. But if i try to compile off it then it tells me that i don't have java JDK version 5 or 6..... I litterly just reinstalled it 3 times.... please help me I'm sure its an easy fix but I'm VERY new when it comes to private server development :/ So, I'D APPRECIATE HELP!! XD

item.title: Need Help With a Compiler Problem
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

You need to make sure you set the IP to localhost on the server and client (and make sure the ports are identical) - then when the client is connecting to the same IP as the server is running on, it’ll make a connection.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help With a Compiler Problem
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

You can’t of set your enviroment variables if Javac isn’t compiling, either that or find a more simple compiler. Try:

@ECHO OFF TITLE Compiling... "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" *.java PAUSE

Change _16 to your JDK version.

And it doesn’t matter that the files are mixed up so long as it’s all in the same folder (otherwise you’d have to set classpaths).

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help With a Compiler Problem

item.title: Need Help With a Compiler Problem
item.dc:creator: @zero380 zero380
item.description:
@zero380 wrote:

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

that my compiler code and how do i check if my client is set to 127.0.0.1 and 43594 port? idk if im running the compiler amungst the .java files the java files are mixed with the .class files

Read full topic

item.source: Need Help With a Compiler Problem

item.title: Need Help With a Compiler Problem
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

No your server did not compile because it found no Java folders. Does your server have folders? One for .java and one for .class?

And the ports have to be the same on both for them to interact together, otherwise packets get sent to the wrong port and don’t get received at the other end.

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help With a Compiler Problem

item.title: Need Help With a Compiler Problem
item.dc:creator: @zero380 zero380
item.description:
@zero380 wrote:

sorry for all the questions, as this is my first server, but how do i change the port of the client? im guessing its 43954 but it doesnt say change port anywhere and whats the difference between a server port and client port?

and also if my compiler says this: javac: file not found: *.java usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options finished! press any key to continue . . .

does that mean my compiler is working?

Read full topic
item.source: Need Help With a Compiler Problem

item.title: Need Help With a Compiler Problem
item.dc:creator: @Thanks Thanks
item.description:
@Thanks wrote:

check you ip’s and port numbers

to do go to client.java(in your source) and then do ctrl+f and then look for 127.0.0.1 if you cant find it then you will need to find the current ip adress and change it to 127.0.0.1

for the ports look up 43594 cuz thats the most common port…tell me whatcha find

Read full topic
